verses.kjv: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;
verses.web: Now I declare to you, brothers, the Good News which I preached to you, which also you received, in which you also stand,
verses.ct: Brothers, I want to remind you of the good news I preached to you — the message you received and the foundation on which you now stand.

verses.kjv: By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.
verses.web: by which also you are saved, if you hold firmly the word which I preached to you—unless you believed in vain.
verses.ct: This is the message that saves you, if you hold firmly to what I told you. Otherwise, your faith was for nothing.

verses.kjv: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;
verses.web: For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
verses.ct: What I passed on to you was the most important thing I myself had received: that Christ died for our sins, just as the Scriptures said he would,

verses.kjv: And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:
verses.web: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,
verses.ct: that he was buried, and that he was raised on the 3rd day, again just as the Scriptures said.

verses.kjv: And that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:
verses.web: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.
verses.ct: After that, he appeared to Cephas, and then to the 12 apostles.

verses.kjv: After that, he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present, but some are fallen asleep.
verses.web: Then he appeared to over five hundred brothers at once, most of whom remain until now, but some have also fallen asleep.
verses.ct: Then he appeared to more than 500 believers at the same time. Most of them are still alive today, though some have died.

verses.kjv: After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.
verses.web: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles,
verses.ct: After that, he appeared to James, and then to all the apostles.

verses.kjv: And last of all he was seen of me also, as of one born out of due time.
verses.web: and last of all, as to the child born at the wrong time, he appeared to me also.
verses.ct: Last of all, he appeared to me — like someone born at the wrong time.

verses.kjv: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
verses.web: For I am the least of the apostles, who is not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the assembly of God.
verses.ct: I'm the least of the apostles. I don't even deserve to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

verses.kjv: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which was bestowed upon me was not in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
verses.web: But by the grace of God I am what I am. His grace which was given to me was not futile, but I worked more than all of them; yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
verses.ct: But by the grace of God, I am what I am. And his grace toward me wasn't wasted — I've worked harder than all the other apostles. Yet it wasn't really me doing the work; it was God's grace working through me.

verses.kjv: Therefore whether it were I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.
verses.web: Whether then it is I or they, so we preach, and so you believed.
verses.ct: So whether it was me or the other apostles who told you, this is what we all preach, and this is what you believed.

verses.kjv: Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verses.web: Now if Christ is preached, that he has been raised from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verses.ct: Now if we preach that Christ has been raised from the dead, how can some of you say there's no such thing as resurrection?

verses.kjv: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then is Christ not risen:
verses.web: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither has Christ been raised.
verses.ct: If there's no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised.

verses.kjv: And if Christ be not risen, then is our preaching vain, and your faith is also vain.
verses.web: If Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is in vain, and your faith also is in vain.
verses.ct: And if Christ hasn't been raised, then everything we preach is meaningless, and your faith is meaningless too.

verses.kjv: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead rise not.
verses.web: Yes, we are also found false witnesses of God, because we testified about God that he raised up Christ, whom he didn’t raise up, if it is so that the dead are not raised.
verses.ct: Worse than that, we'd be liars about God, because we testified that God raised Christ from the dead. But if the dead aren't raised, then God didn't raise him.

verses.kjv: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:
verses.web: For if the dead aren’t raised, neither has Christ been raised.
verses.ct: Because if the dead aren't raised, then Christ hasn't been raised either.

verses.kjv: And if Christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.
verses.web: If Christ has not been raised, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins.
verses.ct: And if Christ hasn't been raised, your faith is useless — you're still trapped in your sins.

verses.kjv: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.
verses.web: Then they also who are fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
verses.ct: And it would mean that everyone who died believing in Christ is lost forever.

verses.kjv: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.
verses.web: If we have only hoped in Christ in this life, we are of all men most pitiable.
verses.ct: If our hope in Christ is only for this life, we are the most pitiful people on earth.

verses.kjv: But now is Christ risen from the dead, and become the firstfruits of them that slept.
verses.web: But now Christ has been raised from the dead. He became the first fruits of those who are asleep.
verses.ct: But the truth is, Christ has been raised from the dead — the first of a great harvest among those who have died.

verses.kjv: For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
verses.web: For since death came by man, the resurrection of the dead also came by man.
verses.ct: Since death came into the world through one man, the resurrection of the dead also comes through one man.

verses.kjv: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.
verses.web: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all will be made alive.
verses.ct: Just as everyone dies because of Adam, everyone will be made alive because of Christ.

verses.kjv: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ’s at his coming.
verses.web: But each in his own order: Christ the first fruits, then those who are Christ’s, at his coming.
verses.ct: But there's an order to it: Christ was raised first, and then when he returns, those who belong to him will be raised.

verses.kjv: Then cometh the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.
verses.web: Then the end comes, when he will deliver up the Kingdom to God, even the Father, when he will have abolished all rule and all authority and power.
verses.ct: After that comes the end, when Christ hands the kingdom over to God the Father, after he has destroyed every ruler, every authority, and every power.

verses.kjv: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.
verses.web: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.
verses.ct: Because Christ must reign until he has put every enemy under his feet.

verses.kjv: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
verses.web: The last enemy that will be abolished is death.
verses.ct: The last enemy to be destroyed is death itself.

verses.kjv: For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.
verses.web: For, “He put all things in subjection under his feet.” But when he says, “All things are put in subjection”, it is evident that he is excepted who subjected all things to him.
verses.ct: For Scripture says, "He has put all things under his feet." Now when it says "all things" are under him, it's obvious that God himself — the one who put everything under Christ — is not included in that.

verses.kjv: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.
verses.web: When all things have been subjected to him, then the Son will also himself be subjected to him who subjected all things to him, that God may be all in all.
verses.ct: And when everything has been placed under Christ's authority, then the Son himself will submit to God, who gave him authority over all things. Then God will be all in all.

verses.kjv: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?
verses.web: Or else what will they do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead aren’t raised at all, why then are they baptized for the dead?
verses.ct: Otherwise, what will people who are baptized for the dead accomplish? If the dead aren't raised at all, why would anyone be baptized on their behalf?

verses.kjv: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?
verses.web: Why do we also stand in jeopardy every hour?
verses.ct: And why would we risk our lives every single hour?

verses.kjv: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our LORD, I die daily.
verses.web: I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.
verses.ct: Brothers, I face death every day — I swear it by the pride I have in you through Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.kjv: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.
verses.web: If I fought with animals at Ephesus for human purposes, what does it profit me? If the dead are not raised, then “let’s eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.”
verses.ct: If I fought wild beasts in Ephesus just for human reasons, what did I gain? If the dead aren't raised, then we might as well say, "Let's eat and drink, because tomorrow we die."

verses.kjv: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
verses.web: Don’t be deceived! “Evil companionships corrupt good morals.”
verses.ct: Don't be fooled: "Bad company corrupts good character."

verses.kjv: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.
verses.web: Wake up righteously, and don’t sin, for some have no knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.
verses.ct: Come to your senses and stop sinning. Some of you don't even know God — I say that to your shame.

verses.kjv: But some man will say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?
verses.web: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised?” and, “With what kind of body do they come?”
verses.ct: But someone will ask, "How exactly are the dead raised? What kind of body will they have?"

verses.kjv: Thou fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:
verses.web: You foolish one, that which you yourself sow is not made alive unless it dies.
verses.ct: What a foolish question! When you plant a seed, it doesn't sprout to life unless it first dies in the ground.

verses.kjv: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other grain:
verses.web: That which you sow, you don’t sow the body that will be, but a bare grain, maybe of wheat, or of some other kind.
verses.ct: And what you plant isn't the full plant that will grow — it's just a bare seed, maybe wheat or something else.

verses.kjv: But God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.
verses.web: But God gives it a body even as it pleased him, and to each seed a body of its own.
verses.ct: But God gives it whatever body he chooses, and he gives each kind of seed its own unique body.

verses.kjv: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, and another of birds.
verses.web: All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one flesh of men, another flesh of animals, another of fish, and another of birds.
verses.ct: Not all flesh is the same. Humans have one kind of flesh, animals have another, fish have another, and birds have yet another.

verses.kjv: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
verses.web: There are also celestial bodies and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial differs from that of the terrestrial.
verses.ct: There are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies, but the glory of the heavenly is completely different from the glory of the earthly.

verses.kjv: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.
verses.web: There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory.
verses.ct: The sun has its own glory, the moon has a different glory, and the stars have still another. Even among stars, each one differs from the others in glory.

verses.kjv: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:
verses.web: So also is the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown perishable; it is raised imperishable.
verses.ct: That's exactly how it is with the resurrection of the dead. The body that's buried is perishable; the body that's raised is imperishable.

verses.kjv: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:
verses.web: It is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.
verses.ct: It's buried in dishonor; it's raised in glory. It's buried in weakness; it's raised in power.

verses.kjv: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
verses.web: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body and there is also a spiritual body.
verses.ct: It's buried as a natural body; it's raised as a spiritual body. If there's a natural body, there's also a spiritual body.

verses.kjv: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam was made a quickening spirit.
verses.web: So also it is written, “The first man, Adam, became a living soul.” The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, "The first man, Adam, became a living soul." But the last Adam — Christ — became a life-giving spirit.

verses.kjv: Howbeit that was not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.
verses.web: However that which is spiritual isn’t first, but that which is natural, then that which is spiritual.
verses.ct: The spiritual didn't come first. The natural came first, and then the spiritual.

verses.kjv: The first man is of the earth, earthy: the second man is the Lord from heaven.
verses.web: The first man is of the earth, made of dust. The second man is the Lord from heaven.
verses.ct: The first man was made from the dust of the earth. The second man is the Lord from heaven.

verses.kjv: As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.
verses.web: As is the one made of dust, such are those who are also made of dust; and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.
verses.ct: Those who are made of dust are like the man of dust, and those who are heavenly are like the man from heaven.

verses.kjv: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.
verses.web: As we have borne the image of those made of dust, let’s also bear the image of the heavenly.
verses.ct: Just as we have carried the image of the man made from dust, we will also carry the image of the man from heaven.

verses.kjv: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.
verses.web: Now I say this, brothers, that flesh and blood can’t inherit God’s Kingdom; neither does the perishable inherit imperishable.
verses.ct: Here's what I'm telling you, brothers: flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, and what is perishable cannot inherit what is imperishable.

verses.kjv: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,
verses.web: Behold, I tell you a mystery. We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed,
verses.ct: Listen — I'm revealing a mystery to you: We won't all die, but we will all be transformed,

verses.kjv: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
verses.web: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we will be changed.
verses.ct: in an instant, in the blink of an eye, at the sound of the last trumpet. The trumpet will blast, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be transformed.

verses.kjv: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
verses.web: For this perishable body must become imperishable, and this mortal must put on immortality.
verses.ct: Because this perishable body must be clothed with the imperishable, and this mortal body must be clothed with immortality.

verses.kjv: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.
verses.web: But when this perishable body will have become imperishable, and this mortal will have put on immortality, then what is written will happen: “Death is swallowed up in victory.”
verses.ct: When this perishable body has been clothed with the imperishable, and this mortal body has been clothed with immortality, then the Scripture will come true: "Death is swallowed up in victory."

verses.kjv: O death, where is thy sting? O grave, where is thy victory?
verses.web: “Death, where is your sting? Hades, where is your victory?”
verses.ct: "Death, where is your sting? Grave, where is your victory?"

verses.kjv: The sting of death is sin; and the strength of sin is the law.
verses.web: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.
verses.ct: The sting of death is sin, and sin gets its power from the law.

verses.kjv: But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.web: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: But thank God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.
verses.web: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the Lord’s work, because you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.
verses.ct: So then, my dear brothers, stand firm. Don't let anything move you. Always give yourselves fully to the Lord's work, because you know that nothing you do for the Lord is ever wasted.
